page.title: 17THATCHAM BOY'S MORNING.
page.content: I woke up at about five minutes to seven feeling very much under the weather. I decided to stay in bed and miss school but it didn't work and I had to go. I ate my breakfast (a bowl of muesli and two slices of toast) and put on my school uniform which consists of one white shirt,a green and silver tie, a pair of grey trousers, a pair of grey socks, a pair of black "beetle crushers" and a green jumper. The jumper bears the Francis Baily badge. After this I brushed my teeth and hair. I was nearly late for school. The morning's work was mainly tracing the path of the previous day's walk from Thatcham all the way to Colthrop Mill and back. Then there was a graph about the length of reigns of all the English monarchs from William the Conqueror to Elizabeth II. Lunchtime at last, five past twelve.
